Title: Relates to eliminating the ability of a court to commit a respondent to jail as a penalty for violation of a support order; repealer
Summary: Eliminates the ability of a court to commit a respondent to jail as a penalty for violation of a support order.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the family court act, in relation to eliminating the ability of a court to commit a respondent to jail as a penalty for violation of a support order; and to repeal certain provisions of such law relating thereto
